key_49.name: Grateful Dead
key_49.set1: Good Lovin' France Fire On The Mountain Stagger Lee If I Had The World To Give Shakedown Street I Need A Miracle Good Lovin' Saint Of Circumstance
key_49.comment:
Lowell sings lead or backup on a few numbers.
"The Dead chose Lowell George as producer in an attempt to get away from the 'in charge producer' role that they had whilst recording Terrapin Station with Keith Olsen. According to Garcia; 'We chose Lowell George because we wanted someone who understood band mechanics.'
Bill Kreutzmann commented in an interview;... 'Lowell was really like a member of the band more. If we were working on a song and he didn't feel it was going right, he'd just grab a guitar and come into the studio and show us how he felt it. That was one of the ways he'd communicate, and it worked great. I had a tremendous amount of respect for him.'
The recording was interrupted by the Egypt tour in 1978. After that tour the Dead cancelled shows in the UK to finish Shakedown Street so that it would be released for their tour in the US in late 1978. Lowell George was not available for the final stages of putting together the album and the production work was completed by John Kahn."

key_58.name: Grateful Dead
key_58.set1: Anubian Folk Song w/ Hamza El-Din Ollin Arageed w/ Hamza El-Din The Grateful Dead take the stage One More Saturday Night (9-16) Paul Krasner interviews Lawrence of Winterland Truckin' (9-14 or 9-16) site seeing Paul Krasner interviews Bob Nichols Bertha > Good Lovin' (9-16) Ollin Arageed Paul Krasner interviews Blaze part 1 Iko Iko (9-16)
key_58.set2: Paul Krasner interviews Blaze part 2 Truckin' (9-14 or 9-16) Estimated Prophet (9-15) Paul Krasner interviews Bill Kreutzman part 1 I Need a Miracle (9-16) inside the pyramids I Need a Miracle > It's All Over Now (intro) Jack Straw (9-15) Paul Krasner interviews Bill Kreutzman part 2 Truckin' (9-14 or 9-16) Grateful Dead flag gets planted on pyramid Fire On the Mountain (9-14) Ken Kesey discussion Row Jimmy Terrapin Station

key_59.name: Grateful Dead
key_59.set1:
credits/ Clips Hand clappers-> promised land Clips of egypt w/ truckin KEsey and Kreutzman with pranksters in egypt Bertha Good luvin Hand clappers/ more Egypt footage with akio-aiko miracle jam with more Egypt footage KEsey and friends with tour guide w/ estimated Kreutzman talks about the Ufo in the pyramid miracle / KEsey & Pranksters and Bill Walton go into the great pyramid inside the great pyramid with KEsey & Pranksters and Bill Walton KEsey & Pranksters and Bill Walton come out of the great pyramid Jack Straw climbing pyramid & flying of dead flag on top /scarlet with empty venue footage Row Jimmy Ken Babbs toast/ terrapin outro
filler: 30 mins of time coded acid test footage

key_76.name: Grateful Dead
key_76.set1: Bob Weir - Jerry's sick promoter Jim Koplick - we'll validate parking... fine
key_76.comment: This show was canceled. From stage, Bob Weir announces that Jerry is sick and that the band will have to reschedule.
